titleStmt.title: Thomas E. Edwards, J. C. Vanarsdall, C. S. Abell, Affidavit
CWG7965

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p: Commonwealth of Ky. Mercer County Sct

We Thos. E. Edward P. J. M. C C, CS. Abell Clerk and I. C. Vanarsdale Sherriff, authorizeed by law to compare the poll books, do certify that at an election held in the Fourth district of Mercer County on Saturday 2nd day of May 1863 Vance Wilson was duly elected to fill the office of Justice of the peace for said district.
Given under our hands this 6th day of May 1863.

Thos Edwards P J M C C
I. C. Vanarsdale S. M. C.
C S Abell Clerk,
Mercer Co. Court
